isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HUBS, BEARINGS, AND SEALS - BEARING CUP (RACE)

svcproc.title: REMOVE (CAST IRON HUB ASSEMBLY)
svcproc.para: Removal is done with hub assembly removed from vehicle (with or without wheel(s) removed from hub assembly), and inner bearing and seal removed from hub assembly.

step1.para: To remove inner bearing cup, place hub assembly flat on floor with outer bearing facing up (toward you).

Use a long suitable steel punch placed through the hub bore. In most cases, the hub assembly will have a couple of notches machined out of the hub assembly. These notches are there for the removal of the bearing cup.

Place the punch in the notch on the cup. Strike the punch with a hammer. Move the punch to the opposite notch and repeat procedure. Moving back and forth in the notches and striking the cup will force the cup from the hub.

warning.para: To prevent eye injury, safety glasses should be worn at all times when assembling or disassembling components.

note.para: If hub does not have removal notches machined into the hub assembly, use a suitable steel punch with a flat end. Place punch on cup portion that is protruding from hub assembly. Strike punch with hammer and work your way around cup in a criss-cross pattern, forcing cup from hub.
To remove outer bearing cup, place hub assembly on floor with brake drum/disc facing up (toward you) and repeat steps 2 and 3 above.
